snippet.title: Laurie Oakes, veteran political journalist, retires aged 73
snippet.content:
Laurie Oakes has announced his retirement, bringing to an end a 50-year career in journalism. The Nine Network's political editor, who is nearing his 74th birthday, announced he was retiring on Thursday afternoon.
Up Next
The worst Australian accents
01:03
More Entertainment News Videos
Previous slide Next slide
Entertainment news highlights
Bitchiness on The Bachelor, Dr G Yunupingu's marvelous career, talk shows take on Trump's transgender ban, fans' anger at Australian Ninja Warrior and Ringo and Paul back together again.
The veteran journalist's career has outlasted 14 Australian prime ministers. He is perhaps best known for reading then-treasurer John Howard's budget speech live on television in 1980 - a day before the budget was due to be handed down. Oakes' last day on air with Nine News will be Friday August 18. Photo: Simon Schluter More to come.
